conclusion: Understand the concept of magnetic field lines and calculate the change in magnetic flux through the square wire frame.
Identify the given values: side length of the square is 0.2 m and rate of change of magnetic field is 10 T/s.
Calculate the area of the square as 0.04 m^2.
Calculate the magnetic flux as 0.4 T·m^2 using the formula Φ = B * A.
Calculate the change in magnetic flux as 0.04 * t.
Determine the time required for the magnetic field to increase from 0 to 10 T as 1 s.
Calculate the change in magnetic flux as 0.04 T·m^2.
Calculate the potential difference between points a and b as 0.04 V.
